render-markdown.nvim Plugin to improve viewing Markdown files in Neovim <!-- panvimdoc-ignore-start --> | Screenshot | Video | | ---------- | --------- | | !Heading | !Heading | | !Table | !Table | | !Quote | !Quote | | !Callout | !Callout | | !Latex | !Latex | <!-- panvimdoc-ignore-end --> Features - Contained: runs entirely inside Neovim with no external windows - Configurable: all components, padding, icons, and colors can be modified - File type agnostic: can render injected into any file - Automatically runs on lazy load file types defined in - Injections: can directly manipulate treesitter to add logical sections - Modal rendering: changes between and view based on mode - Anti-conceal: hides virtual text added by this plugin on cursor line - Window options: changes option values between and view - Large files: only renders visible range, can be entirely disabled based on size - Custom rendering: provides extension point where user can add anything - Renders the following components out of the box: - Headings: icon, color, border, padding ^1, width - Code blocks: background, language icon ^1 ^2, border, padding ^1, width - Code inline: background - Horizontal breaks: icon, color, width - List bullets: icon, color, padding ^1 - Checkboxes: icon, color, user defined states - Block quotes: icon, color, line breaks ^1 - Callouts: icon, color, user defined values, Github & Obsidian defaults - Tables: border, color, alignment indicator, auto align cells ^1 - Links ^1: icon, color, user defined destinations - Latex blocks ^3: renders formulas - Org indent mode ^1: per level padding ^1: Requires neovim >= ^2: Requires icon provider, or ^3: Requires parser and Requirements - Neovim minimum recommended - Nerd font symbols: more details - treesitter parsers: - markdown & markdowninline: Used to parse files - latex Optional: Used to get blocks from files - html Optional: Used to conceal comments - Icon provider plugin Optional: Used for icon above code blocks - mini.icons - nvim-web-devicons - System dependencies: - pylatexenc Optional: Used to transform strings to appropriate unicode using Install lazy.nvim rocks.nvim This plugin is available on LuaRocks packer.nvim Commands | Command | Lua Function | Description | | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | | | | Alias for | | | | Alias for | | | | Alias for | | | | Alias for | | | | Alias for | | | | Alias for | | | | Alias for | | | | Return current state | | | | Sets state, to toggle | | | | Sets state for current buffer, to toggle | | | | Opens the log file for this plugin | | | | Increase anti-conceal margin above and below by 1 | | | | Decrease anti-conceal margin above and below by 1 | | | | Prints information about marks on current line | | | | Prints difference between config and default | Completions This plugin provides completions for both checkboxes and callouts provided you follow the relevant setup. in-process lsp The recommended way of getting completions from this plugin. The full default configuration is provided below for reference. Any part of it can be modified however for many fields this does not make much sense. Some of the more useful fields are discussed further down. <details> <summary>Default Configuration</summary> </details> We use the following definitions when discussing indexing into lists: 1. Cycle: Indexed the length. Example: @ 4 = 1. 2. Clamp: Indexed normally but larger values use the last value in the list. Example: @ 4 = 3.
